job title: BI Data Analyst, Reporting and Analytics
job description:
An International company, located in Plano, TX, is seeking a BI Data Analyst, Reporting and Analytics for a 12+ month contract role.POSITION SUMMARY / SCOPE

High Level Duties
  • Requirements gathering with business
  • Documenting the requirements (CPs and FRs)
  • Develop Wireframes and/or POCs for reports
  • Gap Analysis
  • Facilitation of User Acceptance Testing
  • Following with vendors on development activity/timelines
  • Ad-hoc work
The BI Data Analyst, Reporting and Analytics will manage the internal customer relationship with the specific business group as part of the front-end delivery team to deliver best-in-class reporting and analytics solutions
  • The position requires excellent customer service skills and attention to detail
MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Subject Matter Expertise (50%)
  • Serve as a subject matter expert on reporting & analytics for customer facing business functions
  • Leverages leading-practice reporting and analytical tools to solve business problems
  • Leverages significant knowledge of business and industry trends with applied reporting and analytics to propose strategic solutions to business needs
  • Performs proof of concept development of reporting and analytics solutions
  • Be a thought leader in the organization on customer intelligence, working with teams to better leverage data to gain business insights that influence business strategies
Project Management (30%)
  • Support strategic direction and vision for the customer data & reporting strategy
  • Oversees the development of all reporting (dashboards, views), from discovery through implementation, and ensures it is in alignment with BI data & reporting governance practices.
  • Work with business and business analysts to identify critical business processes impacted by the project and ensure the project manages to the success of those processes
  • Organize and facilitate meetings with business units and project team to identify and resolve issues, manage risks, and communicate project status
  • Escalate project risks/issues as appropriate to Manager
Supervision / Management (20%):
  • Overseeing the day-to-day activities of external vendors and consultants.
  • Co-manage the performance and provide reviews for contingents and contractors in alignment with HR performance review guidelines and overall company vendors management policies
TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS
  • Microsoft Office Suite
  • Microsoft Visio, Project
  • See other technical skills in special skill section
EXPERIENCE / EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS / LICENSES OR CERTIFICATIONS
  • 5+ years of professional experience
  • Minimum Bachelor?s degree in Computer Science; Master's degree in Computer Science, preferred
Requirements:

Experience Needs
  • Ability to own small projects with little oversite
  • Prior banking, call center, and Business Intelligence experience preferred
  • Experience working with enterprise reporting and dashboards
  • Experience working with advanced SQL
  • Prior DBA and/or BI development experience is preferred
  • 3+ years financial services industry experience with focus on Customer Servicing and/or Marketing
  • 3+ yeas reporting, analytics, or business intelligence experience
leveraged within an organization (SAS, Tableau, etc)
  • Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
  • Excellent communication, facilitation, and interpersonal relations skills required
  • Ability to build trust and relationships with data users and internal work groups
  • Strong analytical and customer service skills
  • Able to work with multiple support and project teams while keeping a focus on the main project or other projects that have broad implications for the business unit and BI teams
  • Experience with project management tools and methodologies required
  • Strong attention to detail and strong organization skills
  • Ability to work through ambiguity and manage to project deadlines
